column3: Taranaki was a novelist and short story writer in the New Zealand vernacular. He earned his living as a musician and music teacher and [played in dance bands][2] throughout south Taranaki. He lived in Hawera all his life and this town appears (under other names) in his novels. He was a heavy drinker throughout his life and this contributed to his early death.\r\n\r\nHe wrote four novels

column6: Predicament 1975 ([Predicament][5] 2010) and Pallet on the Floor 1976 ([Pallet on the Floor][6] 1984). \r\nTwo short stories were published posthumously; Cross My Heart And Cut My Throat and The Chimney
